PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Marlow, UK
QUALIFICATIONS

European Engineer (Eur Ing) – FEANI
Member of the Institution of Engineering & Technology (MIET) – Institution of Engineering & Technology (IET)

2019 to date: Forescout Technologies Ltd. – London, UK
Position: Director, Industrial Cybersecurity Sales Specialist
OT Cybersecurity specialist providing industrial control system and OT cyber expertise to frontline account managers through meaningful customer engagement at engineering, technical management, and senior executive levels. Responsible for architecting, pricing, and promoting c Candidate Name:	Paul Evans
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Marlow, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
BSc (Joint Hons), Computing & Electronics – Durham University (1981 – 1984)
Professional Licenses & Certifications:
Chartered Engineer (CEng) – Engineering Council
European Engineer (Eur Ing) – FEANI
Member of the Institution of Engineering & Technology (MIET) – Institution of Engineering & Technology (IET)
CAREER SUMMARY
2019 to date: Forescout Technologies Ltd. – London, UK
Position: Director, Industrial Cybersecurity Sales Specialist
OT Cybersecurity specialist providing industrial control system and OT cyber expertise to frontline account managers through meaningful customer engagement at engineering, technical management, and senior executive levels. Responsible for architecting, pricing, and promoting customer-focused, technical solutions, with a strong emphasis on innovation as a differentiator.
2011 – 2019 Cisco – London / Sydney
2014 – 2019
Position: Senior Business Development Manager – IOT / Industrial Cybersecurity (Global) – London base
Responsible for driving OT cybersecurity sales growth globally, including:
Technical customer engagement at senior engineering and C-suite levels
Development of OT cybersecurity strategies and associated architectures
Conducting proof of values and solution demonstrations
Development of OT cyber go-to-market / partner strategy
Field enablement Vertical focus includes oil and gas, electrical and water utilities, transport, and manufacturing.
Technologies: Industrial asset visibility, malware detection, remote access, software defined segmentation, intrusion protection, security incident response, remote connected machine, asset tracking.
Achievements:
Won Cisco Sales Champion FY17 (awarded to top 10% of Cisco's Sales Organisation)
Won Sales Achiever FY16, FY18 (awarded for surpassing sales target)
2011 – 2014
Position: Senior Business Development Manager - Asia Pacific – Sydney base
Recruited by Cisco to drive sales growth around smart and connected buildings and cities. Worked with major property developers, airport operators and health authorities across the Asia Pacific region to drive efficiencies and improve safety through effective digitisation. Won Cisco innovation prize for tool to improve sales.
2003 – 2011 Aurecon – Sydney, Australia
Position: Principal Consultant – Operational Technology (OT)
Principal Consultant and Technology Discipline Lead - responsible for marketing and business development, as well as design and implementation of technology systems for construction projects, airports, hospitals, rail, power and defence systems.
Expertise covered; networking, collaboration, cyber security, asset tracking, physical security, audio-visual, IPTV, car-park management etc.
Designed and implemented technology solutions for some of the largest projects of their type in the world, including the Saudi-Bahrain Causeway, Hong Kong Airport, NCI Coal Terminal and the proposed 520m high Qatar National Bank Tower.
2001 – 2004 Worldcom
Position: Senior Manager
Authored the Security System specifications, detailing all aspects of electronic security measures to be adopted at WorldCom’s internet, telecommunication, and control room facilities within the Asia Pacific region.
Additionally, responsible for rewriting the Building Management system (BMS) specification, including definition of interfaces to be adopted between conventional BMS systems and the corporate Network Management Systems.
Supervised the design and construction and testing of a Hong Kong Internet Data Centre including all electrical, HVAC and control systems elements.
2000 – 2001 Platinum East Ltd. – Korea
Position: Managing Director
Commissioned to advise on the readiness of the Flight Information System to allow the opening of the newly built Inchon (Seoul) International Airport. This included a detailed review of the many high-level interfaces between the FIDS and external systems such as Baggage Handling, CUTE and Air Traffic Control and for brokering associated agreements between system owners.
1996 – 2000 Airport Authority – Hong Kong
Position: Lead Engineer - Technology Systems
Reporting to the highest level of management of

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
